DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , multicenter , comparative non-randomized study design investigate medico-economic impact adherence INCa guideline ovarian cancer surgery assessment outcome cost per Quality Adjusted Life Years ( QALY ) . A cost-utility study perform . It primarily aim assess Incremental Cost-Utility Ratio ( ICUR ) 3 year two treatment strategy ovarian cancer surgery : adherence INCa quality indicator versus non-adherence INCa quality indicator . Consecutive patient stage IIIC IV ovarian , tubal , primary peritoneal malignancy recruit different health care institution , include comprehensive cancer center , university hospital private hospital . Evaluation adherence quality indicator assess retrospectively ( patient complete treatment ) two independent expert . 200 patient include period 2 year follow 3 year period treatment ( every 4 month first two year every 6 month ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Woman age ≥ 18 year . 2 . Newly diagnose ovarian , tubal peritoneal malignancy . 3 . Epithelial histology . 4 . Stage IIIC IVA extrapelvic carcinomatosis accord FIGO classification 2014 . 5 . Patients undergo primary surgery neoadjuvant chemotherapy . 6 . Performance Status ≤ 2 . 7 . Patient affiliate Social Health Insurance France . 8 . Patient information inform consent form sign prior study specific procedure . 1 . Benign borderline tumor . 2 . Patients extraabdominal disease , except pleural effusion positive cytology . 3 . Other malignancy diagnose previous 5 year except skin cancer ( melanoma ) . 4 .
